_prev_prog_3.Description:
The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps at Tiverton Power are to comply with EPA's accidental prevention rule, OSHA's Process Safety Management rule, and all applicable state and local codes and regulations. The ammonia  chiller system and equipment at Tiverton Power was designed, installed, and now maintained in accordance with the aforementioned codes, laws, and regulations.



The following engineering and administrative controls are in place to eliminate or reduce the possibility of an accidental release at the Tiverton Power facility:



* Electronic ammonia detection, (3 detectors) installed in chiller building and safety relief valve stack. Detection system activates visual alarms at the facility main control center to alert personnel of a possible ammonia leak in the chiller system.

* Ammonia detection is hard wired to ventilation system to activate exhaust fans in the event of a release in the chiller building.

* Refrigeration Control System monitors and controls compressors, condenser, vessels and ammonia pumps. System displays continual operational status of equipment and controls alarms / shutdowns for out of  parameter indications. 

* High level alarms and system shut offs are installed on pressure vessels. Abnormal operating levels sensed in the vessels will activate a shutdown of the compressors.

* Safety relief valves are configured to all pressure vessels to eliminate the potential for an over-pressure condition within the vessel and the refrigeration system.

* Emergency stop buttons installed outside the chiller building on the east and west sides, in facility main control room, and in the 4160 VOlt electric room.

* Computerized Maintenance Management System, (CMMS) initiates and tracks all equipment inspections in the maintenance department to ensure all refrigeration components are maintained in optimum operational and mechancal condition.

* Continual vibration analysis of compressors and condenser fans is provided to alert maintenance personnel of potential equipment malfunction, or failure.

*A pan-tilt-zoom camera with a video  monitor allows monitoring of the chiller room from the control room.

RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Tiverton Power,LLC Tiverton, RI



The accidental release prevention and emergency response policy at Tiverton Power is to comply with all applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations. It is our goal to achieve and sustain " Zero Accident Tolerance" through communication, information, and training. 



Tiverton Power is a combined cycle cogeneration power plant. The regulated substance handled here is Anhydrous Ammonia which is used as a refrigerant in the Air Inlet Chiller to enhance gas turbine performance and efficiency.



The worst case and alternate case scenarios have been determined and the resulting off site consequences are on file at the Tiverton facility and represented in the overall RMP Plan. The Tiverton facility is located in a rural area and there may be off-site consequences in the unlikely event of an ammonia emergency.



The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps at Tiverton Power are to comply with EPA's accidental prevention rule, OSHA's Process Safety Management rule, and all applicable state and local codes and regulations. The ammonia  chiller system and equipment at Tiverton Power was designed, installed, and now maintained in accordance with the aforementioned codes, laws, and regulations.



Tiverton Power has had one accidental release associated with the ammonia process over the last five years.



The emergency response program at Tiverton Power is to contact the Tiverton Fire Department. It is our policy to request the fire department's response to any emergency and to inspect our facility yearly to ensure they are familiar with our systems and materials.



There are no current plans to revise the ammonia process at Tiverton Power. If required in the future, the changes would be processed through the PSM Management of Change procedures. The Tiverton Chiller System will continue to be monitored via required Process Hazard Analysis and PSM / RMP Complian

ce Audits.



Currently there are no plans to revise existing programs being administered at Tiverton Power.  The system and related programs and equipment will be periodically monitored and improved through regular maintenance inspections, compliance audits and Process Hazard Analysis.
